metadata.title: "Coyote's Journey"
metadata.author: Chester Pepper
metadata.publication: William Bright, The Karok Language (1957), pp. 170-177, Text 3

s.txt:
pihnêefich
vaa
u kúphaa nik .
s.trans: Coyote did that.

s.txt:
panámniik
u 'íf anik .
s.trans: He grew up at Orleans.

s.txt:
vaa
káan
mu thívthaaneen .
s.trans: That was his country there.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xús aanik "
chími
káruk
ishpúk
kan ikyâan
kahyúras ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me go upriver to get money at Klamath Lakes!"

s.txt:
xás
u paríshriihva
an tunvêech .
s.trans: And he twined little strings.

s.txt:
ithéeshyav
u paríshriihva .
s.trans: He twined a whole winter.

s.txt:
achavúra
ithá 'iithva
vaa
kóo
u paríshriihva .
s.trans: Finally he twined a whole pack.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u vâaram .
s.trans: Then he left.

s.txt:
xás
páy
pa sâam
u saamvárak ti
u 'árihroov .
s.trans: And he went upriver downhill where that flows down from upriver.
s.note: Bright: "páy pasâam usaamvárakti 'downhill where that flows down from upriver' is a circumlocution meaning simply 'by the river.'"

s.txt:
koovúra
pa 'áraar
u máah vunaa tih , "
iimkun
vúra
pufáat sa hara .
s.trans: He saw all the people (and said), "You-all are just nothings.

s.txt:
naa
kahyúras
tá
ni vâaram ."
s.trans: I am leaving for Klamath Lakes."

s.txt:
chavúra
ôok
ithivthanéen'aachip
t u 'árihroov .
s.trans: Finally he traveled upriver to the center of the world here.

s.txt:
káan
xás
u máh
áraar ,
u phikirîih vu tih .
s.trans: And there he saw a person, he was sweating himself.
s.note: Bright: "This person was chiimûch 'Lizard'; cf. sentence 177."

s.txt:
káan
t u vúrayvikeethun .
s.trans: (Coyote) walked around there.

s.txt:
yánava
páy
fâatva
u tháthriinaa .
s.trans: He saw something sitting in baskets.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
tîi
kan pakatkâat ih ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me taste it!"

s.txt:
kári
xás
u pakatkát aheen .
s.trans: So he tasted it.

s.txt: amayaa 'íshara .
s.trans: It was very good-tasting.

s.txt:
chavúra
koovúra
u páfip .
s.trans: Finally he drank it all up.

s.txt:
xás
pa mu 'asíp haar
u thaxávxav .
s.trans: And he chewed up (the person's) baskets to boot.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ta'ítam
u 'áhoo heen .
s.trans: And then he traveled (on).

s.txt:
xás
ú peen ti "
îim
ôok
keemisha 'îin
i 'áv eesh ap ."
s.trans: And he told (the person sweating), "A monster outside here is going to eat you."

s.txt:
kári
xás
p oo vôonupuk
ikmaháchraam
u vôonupuk .
s.trans: And when he went out, (the person sweating) came out of the sweathouse.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
eee !
naa
ni p êesh '
pihnêefich
ôok
u vúrayvu tih een .'
s.trans: And he thought, "Ah, I'll bet Coyote has been around here!

s.txt:
vaa
pa nini 'íshaha
t u pafipsîiprin aheen .
s.trans: He's drunk up that juice of mine.

s.txt:
kíri
íshaha
ú xrah ."
s.trans: May he get thirsty!"

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
vaa
kíp
kôok
u víshvaan ti
xathímtas ."
s.trans: And he thought, "He just likes that kind, roasted grasshoppers."

s.txt:
xás
u píip "
chími
kám 'iinv i
mú 'aavkam ."
s.trans: And he said, "Let there be a forest fire in front of him!"

s.txt:
kárukvari
t u 'árihroov .
s.trans: (Coyote) went on upriver.

s.txt: t u 'invá kaam ha .
s.trans: There was a big forest fire.

s.txt:
xás
t u túraayva ,
vúra
uum
táay
pa xathímtas .
s.trans: And he looked around, there were lots of grasshoppers.

s.txt:
"
vúra
pu na 'áv eesh ara ."
s.trans: "I won't eat them."

s.txt:
chavúra
yiimúsich
t u 'uum .
s.trans: Finally he went a little ways.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
tîi
matée
kóomahich
kan 'ífapv i
pa xathímtas .
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me pick up a few roasted grasshoppers for a moment!"

s.txt:
hínupa
chími
u 'ífapv eesh .
s.trans: He was going to pick them up.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xú ti "
hûut
áta
kúth
pa pu na yâavahi tih ara ."
s.trans: And (after he had eaten them), he thought "I wonder why I'm not getting full?"

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
naa
ni xú ti '
ífuthkam
na pávyiihrishuk tih
pa ni 'áam ti .'"
s.trans: And he thought, "I think they're coming out of me in the rear as I eat."

s.txt:
xás
u xús "
chími
pa nini 'afupchúrax
chími
kan ip shivshâap i ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me seal up my anus."
Then he got pitch.

s.txt:
xás
pa mu 'afupchúrax
vaa
ku mûuk
u p sívshap .
s.trans: And he sealed up his anus with that.

s.txt:
xás
u xús "
púya
páy
uum ,
payêem
uum
na yâavah eesh .
s.trans: And he thought, "There, now I'll get full.

s.txt:
tá
íp
ni p shívshaap at
pa nini 'afupchúrax ."
s.trans: I've sealed up my anus."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u 'aam vá heen .
s.trans: So he ate.

s.txt:
vúra
t u 'invá kaam ha .
s.trans: There was a big forest fire.

s.txt:
víri
káan
u kuchnáxathuna tih .
s.trans: (Coyote) was sticking his buttocks around there.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
ni xú ti '
chími
ni 'uum êesh
kahyúras .'"
s.trans: And he thought, "I think I'm about to reach Klamath Lakes."

s.txt:
t u thítiv
p oo thivnúru tih .
s.trans: He heard it thundering.

s.txt:
vaa
u kupa thitív ahi tih ,
kúnish
u pí ti "
huhuhuhuhuhu ."
s.trans: He heard that, it sort of said, "Huhuhuhuhuhu."

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
chími
ni 'uum êesh
kahyúras ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I'm about to reach Klamath Lakes."
s.note: Bright: "Coyote thought that the noise was made by the falls at Klamath Lakes."

s.txt:
vaa
kích
p oo thítiv
pá huhuhuhuhuhu .
s.trans: He just heard that "Huhuhuhuhuhu."

s.txt:
hinupáy
pa mu 'afupchúrax
p oo 'iinkú tih .
s.trans: There it was his anus burning.

s.txt:
hinupáy
íp
pa 'axváha
mûuk
u p sívshaap at
hinupáy
vaa
p oo 'iinkú tih .
s.trans: There it was the pitch he had sealed it with that was burning.

s.txt:
víri
hûut
chími
u 'îin eesh .
s.trans: (He wondered) what he should do.

s.txt:
vaa
vúra
káan
âapun
yúux ak
u kûuruthun .
s.trans: He slid all over there that way, on the ground, in the dirt.

s.txt:
víri va
kích
u pí ti "
átuhtuhtuhtuhtuhtuh ."
s.trans: He was just saying, "átuhtuhtuhtuhtuh!"

s.txt:
púyava
chavúra
ú msip
pa mu 'afupchúrax .
s.trans: So finally his anus was extinguished.

s.txt:
púyava
u xús "
payêem
vúra
pu na 'ípav eesh ara
pa xathímtas .
s.trans: So he thought, "Now I won't eat roasted grasshoppers again.

s.txt:
tá
koo ,
vúra
pu na 'áv eesh ara ."
s.trans: That's all, I won't eat them."

s.txt:
chímiva
vaa
kúna
u kúupha ,
íshaha
ú xrah .
s.trans: Soon he did this also, he got thirsty.

s.txt:
úma
vaa
u kúphaa nik ,
pá mitva
ithéeshyav
u paríshriihva
an tunvêech .
s.trans: That's what he had done, he twined little strings the previous winter.

s.txt:
hôoyvarihva
t óo
xyáthuroov aheen .
s.trans: He had lost them somewhere.

s.txt:
víri
hûut
chími
u kuph eesh .
s.trans: So what was he to do?

s.txt:
pa 'íshaha
t óo
xrah .
s.trans: He was thirsty.

s.txt:
yiimúsich
t óo
tsîip .
s.trans: He looked off a little ways.

s.txt:
yanéekva
pa saamvároo
u vúrunih tih .
s.trans: There was a creek flowing down.

s.txt:
káan
t u 'uum .
s.trans: He got there.

s.txt: t u pivaxráh een .
s.trans: It had dried up.

s.txt:
pâanpay
vaa
t óo
kvíripship .
s.trans: After a while he broke into a run.

s.txt:
káan
t u 'uum .
s.trans: He got there.

s.txt: t u pivaxráh een .
s.trans: It had dried up.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
vúra
pu na 'ísh eesh ara
ishkéesh 'aas ."
s.trans: And he thought, "I won't drink river water."

s.txt:
mú vaas
u 'iithvú tih .
s.trans: He was carrying his blanket.

s.txt:
"
payêem
pa ni máh aak
pa saamvároo
pa niní vaas
kúuk
ni paathm éesh .
s.trans: "Now when I see a creek, I'll throw my blanket at it.

s.txt:
xasík
vaa
ni pachipchíp eesh ."
s.trans: Then I can suck on that."

s.txt:
xás
p oo máh
pa saamvároo
ta'ítam
kúuk
u paathm áheen .
s.trans: And when he saw the creek, then he threw (the blanket) at it.

s.txt:
ivaxráhak
xás
u kyívish .
s.trans: But it fell on dry ground.

s.txt:
vúra
íshaha
t óo
xrah .
s.trans: He was really thirsty.

s.txt:
"
vúra
pu na 'ísh eesh ara
ishkéesh 'aas ."
s.trans: "I won't drink river water."

s.txt:
víri
vaa
u kupí tih .
s.trans: He did that.

s.txt:
vúra
t u 'invá kaam ha .
s.trans: There was a big forest fire.

s.txt:
víri
úuth
ishkêesh ak
t u 'ahirímkaanva .
s.trans: There were trees falling out into the river.

s.txt:
xás
u xú ti "
xâatik
vúra
ni 'ish ,
p eeshkéesh 'aas .
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me drink the river water.

s.txt:
kúna
vúra
pu 'astíip ich
na 'ísh eesh ara .
s.trans: But I won't drink by the bank.

s.txt:
vúra
ishkéesh 'aachip
xasík
ni 'ísh eesh ."
s.trans: I'll drink in the middle of the river.

s.txt:
chavúra
u máh
yánava
ithyáruk
u kúripaa hi ti
itháriip .
s.trans: Finally he saw it, he saw a fir tree lying fallen out across-stream.

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xús "
vaa
pay'ôok
xasík
íshaha
ni 'ísh eesh ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Here I will drink water."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u vátakar aheen .
s.trans: So he walked out on it.

s.txt:
kári
xás
ishkéesh 'aachip
ta'ítam
u kúkurih een .
s.trans: And in the middle of the river he stooped down to the water.

s.txt:
víri
p oo kúkurih
chímiva
úuth
ú kyiimkar .
s.trans: When he stooped down, he suddenly fell in.

s.txt: u síinvar .
s.trans: He drowned.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u p thívruuhvarak .
s.trans: So he floated back down from upstream.

s.txt:
víri
vúra
uum
táay
pa 'ahup tunvêech as
u 'áthanvarak tih .
s.trans: There were a lot of little sticks floating down from upriver.

s.txt:
xás
pihnêefich
u xús "
chími
ahup yâamach
kan párihish .
s.trans: And Coyote thought, "Let me become a pretty stick!

s.txt:
vaa
uum
hôoy
vúrava
kanée p taatripaa vish ."
s.trans: That way they will hook me out somewhere.

s.txt:
yíiv
t u thívruuhma .
s.trans: He floated a long ways.

s.txt:
chími
axmáy
yúruk
u trûupu tih .
s.trans: Suddenly he looked downriver.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
kun kupí tih ,
pa 'asiktávaan sa
kun xú ti "
kíri
nu tururípa n
pa 'áhup ."
s.trans: They were doing that, the women were trying to hook out the sticks.
s.note: Bright: "Literally, 'the women thought, 'let us hook out sticks!''"

s.txt:
xás
pihnêefich
t u tápkuup
pa 'asiktávaan sa .
s.trans: And Coyote took a liking to the women.

s.txt:
chavúra
kaanvári
u thívruuhma .
s.trans: Finally he floated to that vicinity.

s.txt:
víri
u vuunôovu tih .
s.trans: There was an eddy.

s.txt:
víri va
káan
ta'ítam
pihnêefich
káan
u thívruuhma .
s.trans: So then Coyote floated to there.

s.txt:
"
ooo !"
pa 'asiktávaan sa
kun piip , "
ooo !
yáxa
páykuuk
kóo
ahup yâamach
u thivrúhuthuna tih .
s.trans: "Oh," the women said, "oh, look there, such a pretty stick is floating around.

s.txt:
chími
nú taatripaa ."
s.trans: Let's hook it out!"

s.txt:
víri va
kun tafiripfírip tih .
s.trans: But they kept missing it.

s.txt:
káruma
uum
pihnêefich
u xú ti "
xáy
kaná taatripaa ."
s.trans: Coyote was thinking, "Let them not hook me out."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xús "
chími
kan ip thívruuhsun ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me float away!"

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u p thívruuhrup .
s.trans: So he floated downriver again.

s.txt:
chavúra
kúkuum
vaa
káan
u máh
asiktávaan sa
astiip ,
áhup
kun ikyáa vanaa tih .
s.trans: Finally he saw women there on the bank again, they were gathering wood.

s.txt:
xás
yítha
u píip "
ooo !
yáxa
kóo
ahup yâamach
t u thívruuhvarak ."
s.trans: And one said, "Oh, look, such a pretty stick has floated down from upstream!"

s.txt:
xás
yíth
u píip "
atafâat naa
pihnêefich .
s.trans: And another said, "Maybe it's Coyote.

s.txt:
mít
kun íp aat '
kahyúras
t u vâaram .'
s.trans: They said he had left for Klamath Lakes.

s.txt:
ípararah um ,
atafâat naa
vaa ."
s.trans: He's not reliable, maybe that's him."
s.note: Bright: "Literally, 'is he reliable?' A question is often used in Karok as a rhetorical equivalent of a negative."

s.txt:
púyava
ník
kun ímuus tih .
s.trans: So they looked at it.

s.txt:
káan
vúra
t u thivrúhuthun .
s.trans: It floated around there.

s.txt:
"
xáyfaat
nú hmaachichva ."
s.trans: "Let's not fool with it."

s.txt:
xás
úuth
kun píkfuutkar .
s.trans: So they pushed it back out into the river.

s.txt:
"
eee !"
xás
u xú ti
pihnêefich "
yáas
naa
ni xú ti '
tá
ni shíinvar .'"
s.trans: "Ah," Coyote thought then, "now I think I've drowned."

s.txt:
kôokaninay
vúra
pa kun máah ti
úuth
kun píkfuutkaan va .
s.trans: Everywhere they saw him, they pushed him back out into the river.

s.txt:
chavúra
yûum
kuma yúras ak
u thívruuhramnih .
s.trans: Finally he floated into the ocean downriver.

s.txt:
káan
xás
u thivrúhish .
s.trans: He floated to shore there.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
t óo
sir
pihnêefich .
s.trans: Coyote was just lost.

s.txt:
káan
vúra
u vúrayvikeethun .
s.trans: He walked around there.

s.txt:
yánava
káan
ikmaháchraam
u 'íikra .
s.trans: He saw a sweathouse standing there.

s.txt:
xás
u tvâamnath .
s.trans: So he looked inside.

s.txt:
yánava
púra kará xay
vúra .
s.trans: He saw nobody.

s.txt:
xás
u vôoruvrath
pihnêefich .
s.trans: So Coyote crawled in.

s.txt:
xás
sú'
p óo 'uum ,
p oo tvárayva ,
pa mukun 'ikrívkir
koovúra
athkurit múrax
vúra .
s.trans: And when he got inside and looked around, (the people's) seats were all of nothing but fat.

s.txt:
pa mukun patúmkir
káru
vúra
athkúrit .
s.trans: Their pillows were fat too.

s.txt:
káru
pa mukun piykiríkir
vaa
káru
vúra
athkúrit .
s.trans: And their ladder was fat too.

s.txt:
xás
vúra
t óo
xúriha
pihnêefich .
s.trans: And Coyote was hungry.

s.txt:
u xú ti "
tîi
kan pakatkâat i
pa patúmkir ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me taste the pillows!"

s.txt:
xás
p oo pakátkat
amayaa 'íshara .
s.trans: And when he tasted them, they were very good-tasting.

s.txt:
chavúra
koovúra
u tháfip ,
pa mukun piykiríkir
vaa
káru
vúra
u tháfip .
s.trans: Finally he ate them all up, he ate their ladder up too.

s.txt:
xás
axmáy
fâat
kúnish
u thítiv .
s.trans: And suddenly he sort of heard something.

s.txt:
xás
u xús "
chími
kan íchunv i ."
s.trans: And he thought, "Let me hide!"

s.txt:
xás
vaa
káan
ahup'iyvoorá maam
káan
u 'áasish .
s.trans: And he lay down there behind the woodpile.

s.txt:
xás
ikxúrar
pa kun pavyíhivrath .
s.trans: And in the evening (the people) came back in the sweathouse"

s.txt:
ith 'áraan
ník
kúna
t óo
p vôoruvrath ,
kun ithyivúniih vu tih .
s.trans: (As) each person crawled in, they fell down.
s.note: Bright: "Not basic ith'áraan 'stranger,' but and external-sandhi variant of basic ith'áraara 'one person, each person.'"

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun píip "
naa
ni xú ti '
pihnêefich
ôokninay
u vúrayvu tih .'
s.trans: And they said, "I think Coyote is wandering around here.

s.txt:
vaa
pá vaa
tá
kupavêenah an ,
koovúra
t u tháfip
pa nunu patúmkir ."
s.trans: That's who did that, he ate up all our pillows."

s.txt:
vúra
vaa
u tháaniv ,
u thítiim ti
pa kun chuphúruthuna tih .
s.trans: (Coyote) lay like that, he heard them talking about him.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun píip "
chími
nu pákmuuvan v i
uknamxánahich ."
s.trans: And they said, "Let's spend the night away from home, at uknamxánahich."

s.txt:
kári
xás
u xú ti
pihnêefich "
nani thívthaaneen
tá
kun chuphúruthun ."
s.trans: And Coyote thought, "They're talking about my country."

s.txt:
xás
u 'árihrishuk .
s.trans: And he jumped out.

s.txt:
"
ishávaas ,
nani shavás iivsha ,
ni p thivkée vish ."
s.trans: "Nephew, my nephew, I'll go along."

s.txt:
xás
kun píip "
chémi .
s.trans: And they said, "All right.

s.txt:
kúna
vúra
xáyfaat
i yúupha ."
s.trans: But don't open your eyes."

s.txt:
"
chémi ,
vaa
ník
ni kuph eesh .
s.trans: "All right, I'll do that.

s.txt:
vúra
pu ná yuuph eesh ara ."
s.trans: I won't open my eyes."

s.txt:
xás
kun ipêer "
chími
páah ak
váramnih .
s.trans: And they told him, "Get in the boat.

s.txt:
súva
ník
asámyiith
u xák eesh ,
i xus êesh '
tá
nu pávyiihma .'
s.trans: You will hear gravel sound, you will know we have arrived.

s.txt:
púyava
ík
kári
xasík
i yúuph eesh .
s.trans: Then you can open your eyes.

s.txt:
kúna
p ee yuuph âak
pu kin pávyiihm eesh ara .
s.trans: But if you open your eyes (before), we won't get there.

s.txt:
vaa
vúra
ôok
nu p thivrúhuk eesh ."
s.trans: We'll float back to here."

s.txt:
"
chémi ,
vaa
ník
ni kuph eesh ."
s.trans: "All right, I'll do that."

s.txt:
kári
xás
ta'ítam
kun íp viitshur aheen .
s.trans: And so they paddled off.

s.txt:
pihnêefich "
páah ak "
kun ipêer "
sú'
ithxuuprámnih i ."
s.trans: They told Coyote, "Lie face down in the boat."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
pihnêefich
ú thxuupramnih .
s.trans: So Coyote lay face down in it.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
kun íp viitshur aheen .
s.trans: So they paddled off.

s.txt:
chavúra
t u 'ûuri
pihnêefich
p óo thxuupramnih .
s.trans: Finally Coyote got tired of lying face down.

s.txt:
xás
u xús
pihnêefich "
tîi
kan itníshuk ."
s.trans: And Coyote thought, "Let me look out!"

s.txt:
víri
p oo tníshuk
víri
uumyâach
kun ip thivrúhish
úuth
yúrastiim .
s.trans: When he barely looked out, they floated ashore out at the ocean, at the seashore.

s.txt:
xás
kun ípeen ti
pihnêefich "
payêem
pu kin ípkookanp eesh ara ."
s.trans: Then they told Coyote, "Now you won't go with us again."

s.txt:
xás
pihnêefich
u píip "
payêem
ník
vúra
ishávaas
vaa
pu nee p kuph êesh ara ."
s.trans: And Coyote said, "I won't do it again this time, nephew."

s.txt:
"
chémi ,
chôora ."
s.trans: "All right, let's go."

s.txt:
ta'ítam
kun pávyiihshipree heen .
s.trans: So they left.

s.txt:
ta'ítam
kúkuum
u 'asimchák aheen .
s.trans: Then (Coyote) closed his eyes again.

s.txt:
chavúra
xára
tah ,
axmáy
asámyiith
ú xak .
s.trans: Finally it was a long time, (when) suddenly gravel sounded.

s.txt:
kári
xás
kun ipêer
pihnêefich "
chími
várip i
páah ak ."
s.trans: And they told Coyote, "Get out of the boat!"

s.txt:
p oo várip
yánava "
nani thívthaaneen
tá
ni 'ípak ."
s.trans: When he got out, he saw, (he said), "I've come back to my country!"

s.txt:
ta'ítam
u takníhithun aheen .
s.trans: Then he rolled around.

s.txt:
yôotva ,
nani shívshaaneen
tá
ni 'ípak ."
s.trans: "Hurray, I've come back to my country!"

s.txt:
púya
vaa
u kúph aanik
pihnêefich .
s.trans: So that's what Coyote did.

s.txt:
káruk
ishpúk
u kyâar anik .
s.trans: He went upriver to get money.

s.txt:
víri
vaa
u kúph aanik
pihnêefich .
s.trans: That's what Coyote did.

s.txt:
púra fâat
vúra
yáv hanik .
s.trans: Nothing was any good.

s.txt:
chiimuuch 'îin
kun xúseer anik "
kíri
vaa
u kúupha ,
pufáat
vúra
yáv heesh ara ."
s.trans: Lizard thought about him, "Let him do that, nothing will be any good."
